_command.title: RTFM
_config.title: Preferred Language Resources
_config.description:
For each syntax/language specify which resource (website) to target. The options vary based on what the websites supported and what seemed to produce the best results.
Your choices generally include:
• A regular Duck Duck Go or Google search. It automatically includes the syntax name, and shows a full result listing. (Slower but more reliable.)
• Direct query (e.g., mozilla.org, php.net)
• The "... via Duck Duck Go redirect" searches limit results to the one site, and auto-redirects to the first search result. This is fastest, usually great, and sometimes off the mark.
• Some syntaxes can be set to be treated as others (e.g., CoffeeScript can be set to "Use Javascript settings").
_config.custom_description: If you know how, you can create your own search URLs to assign to any syntaxes. The search URL should use the placeholder %@ for the search term, and (optionally) %$ for the current syntax. Use + between words or tokens in the URL instead of spaces.
_rsrc_name.haml-ddg: Haml.info via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.hdr-ddg: HTML5Doctor.com via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.jquery-ddg: jQuery API via Duck Duck Go redirect

_rsrc_name.moz-ddg: Mozilla.org via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.nova-ddg: Nova API docs via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.perl-ddg: Perl.org via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.python-ddg: Python.org via Duck Duck Go redirect

_rsrc_name.sass-ddg: Sass-lang.com via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.smarty-ddg: Smarty.net via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.typs-ddg: TypeScriptLang.org via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.w3s-ddg: W3Schools.com via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.mar-ddg: MariaDB.com via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.mys-ddg: MySQL.com via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.mys5-ddg: MySQL.com v5 via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.pgs-ddg: PostgreSQL.org via Duck Duck Go redirect
_rsrc_name.react-ddg: ReactJS.org via Duck Duck Go redirect
_prompt.search_string:
Your search will be sent to
%@1
_err.syntax_not_supported: RTFM does not yet support documents of type `%@1`.
_err.open_url_failed: Sorry, the URL for this resource could not be opened.
_err.invalid_custom_url: Sorry; The 'Custom URL' specified for `%@1` seems to be invalid.
_err.bad_notify_reply: Could not receive text-input from dialog.
_err.no_search_resource: Please assign a search resource in the preferences for %@1
